intro: Scurrula rhododendricola, commonly known as the red-leaved scurrula, is a rare and striking plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes many shrubs and evergreens adapted to acidic soils. The plant is characterized by its vibrant red leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
